com.microsoft.windowsazure.management.compute

Class OperatingSystemOperationsImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.windowsazure.management.compute.OperatingSystemOperationsImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServiceOperations<ComputeManagementClientImpl>, OperatingSystemOperations

    public class OperatingSystemOperationsImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements ServiceOperations<ComputeManagementClientImpl>, OperatingSystemOperations
    Operations for determining the version of the Azure Guest Operating System on which your service is running. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/ff684169.aspx for more information)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ComputeManagementClientImpl getClient()
      Gets a reference to the microsoft.windowsazure.management.compute.ComputeManagementClientImpl.
      OperatingSystemListResponse list()
      The List Operating Systems operation lists the versions of the guest operating system that are currently available in Windows Azure.
      java.util.concurrent.Future<OperatingSystemListResponse> listAsync()
      The List Operating Systems operation lists the versions of the guest operating system that are currently available in Windows Azure.
      OperatingSystemListFamiliesResponse listFamilies()
      The List OS Families operation lists the guest operating system families available in Azure, and also lists the operating system versions available for each family.
      java.util.concurrent.Future<OperatingSystemListFamiliesResponse> listFamiliesAsync()
      The List OS Families operation lists the guest operating system families available in Azure, and also lists the operating system versions available for each family.

      • getClient

      • listAsync

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<OperatingSystemListResponse> listAsync()
        The List Operating Systems operation lists the versions of the guest operating system that are currently available in Windows Azure. The 2010-10-28 version of List Operating Systems also indicates what family an operating system version belongs to. Currently Azure supports two operating system families: the Azure guest operating system that is substantially compatible with Windows Server 2008 SP2, and the Azure guest operating system that is substantially compatible with Windows Server 2008 R2. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/ff684168.aspx for more information)
        Specified by:
        listAsync in interface OperatingSystemOperations
        Returns:
        The List Operating Systems operation response.

      • list

        public OperatingSystemListResponse list()
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        ServiceException,
                                        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                        org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                        java.net.URISyntaxException
        The List Operating Systems operation lists the versions of the guest operating system that are currently available in Windows Azure. The 2010-10-28 version of List Operating Systems also indicates what family an operating system version belongs to. Currently Azure supports two operating system families: the Azure guest operating system that is substantially compatible with Windows Server 2008 SP2, and the Azure guest operating system that is substantially compatible with Windows Server 2008 R2. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/ff684168.aspx for more information)
        Specified by:
        list in interface OperatingSystemOperations
        Returns:
        The List Operating Systems operation response.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.
        ServiceException - Thrown if an unexpected response is found.
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - Thrown if there was a serious configuration error with the document parser.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - Thrown if there was an error parsing the XML response.
        java.net.URISyntaxException - Thrown if there was an error parsing a URI in the response.

      • listFamiliesAsync

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<OperatingSystemListFamiliesResponse> listFamiliesAsync()
        The List OS Families operation lists the guest operating system families available in Azure, and also lists the operating system versions available for each family. Currently Azure supports two operating system families: the Azure guest operating system that is substantially compatible with Windows Server 2008 SP2, and the Azure guest operating system that is substantially compatible with Windows Server 2008 R2. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/gg441291.aspx for more information)
        Specified by:
        listFamiliesAsync in interface OperatingSystemOperations
        Returns:
        The List Operating System Families operation response.

      • listFamilies

        public OperatingSystemListFamiliesResponse listFamilies()
                                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                                        ServiceException,
                                                        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                                        org.xml.sax.SAXException
        The List OS Families operation lists the guest operating system families available in Azure, and also lists the operating system versions available for each family. Currently Azure supports two operating system families: the Azure guest operating system that is substantially compatible with Windows Server 2008 SP2, and the Azure guest operating system that is substantially compatible with Windows Server 2008 R2. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/gg441291.aspx for more information)
        Specified by:
        listFamilies in interface OperatingSystemOperations
        Returns:
        The List Operating System Families operation response.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.
        ServiceException - Thrown if an unexpected response is found.
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - Thrown if there was a serious configuration error with the document parser.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - Thrown if there was an error parsing the XML response.
